edu.holycross.shot.hocuspocus
[Groovy] Class Corpus

java.lang.Object
  edu.holycross.shot.hocuspocus.Corpus

class Corpus

Fundamental class representing the archival version of atext corpus as a collection of XML documents cataloged by a CTS TextInventory.

Field Summary
java.lang.Integer debug

 
Property Summary
java.io.File baseDirectory

Root directory of file system containing archival files.
java.lang.String charEnc

Character encoding to use for all file output.
java.lang.String defaultTokensFile

TextInventory inventory

TextInventory with entries for all documents in the corpus.
java.io.File inventoryXml

XML serialization of TextInventory information, in a File.
java.util.LinkedHashMap languageToAnalyticalEditionMap

Map to configure default analytical edition generating system for given ISO language codes.
java.util.LinkedHashMap languageToTokenSystemMap

Map to configure default tokenization system for given ISO language codes.
java.lang.String prefix

TTL prefix declaration for HMT namespace.
java.lang.String separatorString

String value defining columns in tabular text format.

Determines if the set of online documents in the corpus' TextInventory has a one-to-one correspondence with the set of .xml files in the corpus' file storage.

Creates three files in workDir for a requested urn containing a classified tokenization, a new subordinate analytical edtiion in tabular format, and the same new edition in TTL format.

Constructor Detail

Corpus

Corpus(java.io.File invFile, java.io.File baseDir)
Constructor using a local File object for the corpus' TextInventory.
baseDir:
Root directory of file system containing archival files.
throws:
Exception if invFile is not a valid TextInventory, or if archive directory is not readable
Parameters:
invFile - File with the corpus' TextInventory.

Method Detail

analyticalEditionSystemForUrn

java.lang.String analyticalEditionSystemForUrn(CtsUrn urn)
Selects an analytical edition generator based on the language of a document identified by URN.
returns:
A String with the full name of a class implementing the analytical edition interface.
throws:
Exception if cannot determine work level of urn.
Parameters:
urn - URN to map to an edition generating system.

analyzeRepository

void analyzeRepository(java.io.File workDir)
Generates analytical editions for entire repository using default settings for analysis.
Parameters:
workDir - Directory where output will be written.

filesAndInventoryMatch

boolean filesAndInventoryMatch()
Determines if the set of online documents in the corpus' TextInventory has a one-to-one correspondence with the set of .xml files in the corpus' file storage.
returns:
True if the two sets are equal, otherwise false.

filesInArchive

java.util.ArrayList filesInArchive()
Recursively walks through the file system where archival files are kepts, and finds all finds with names ending in '.xml'.
returns:
A list of file names, with paths relative to the base directory of this corpus' file storage.

filesInInventory

java.util.ArrayList filesInInventory()
Creates a list of file paths relative to the archive root for documents marked in the corpus text inventory as online.

filesMissingFromInventory

java.util.ArrayList filesMissingFromInventory()
Creates a list of all .xml files in the archive lacking a corresponding "online" entry in the corpus TextInventory.
returns:
A (possibly empty) list of file names.

generateAnalyticalEditionForUrn

void generateAnalyticalEditionForUrn(java.lang.String urnStr, java.io.File workDir)
Creates three files in workDir for a requested urn containing a classified tokenization, a new subordinate analytical edtiion in tabular format, and the same new edition in TTL format.
Parameters:
urn - The text to analyze.
workDir - A writable directory where output will be placed.

generateAnalyticalEditionForUrn

void generateAnalyticalEditionForUrn(CtsUrn urn, java.io.File workDir)
Creates three files in workDir for a requested urn containing a classified tokenization, a new subordinate analytical edtiion in tabular format, and the same new edition in TTL format.
Parameters:
urn - The text to analyze.
workDir - A writable directory where output will be placed.

inventoriedMissingFromArchive

java.util.ArrayList inventoriedMissingFromArchive()
Creates a list of all files categorized as "online" in the corpus TextInventory, but not appearing as a file in the file system.
returns:
A (possibly empty) list of file names.

tabulateFile

void tabulateFile(CtsUrn urn, java.io.File outputDir)

tabulateFile

void tabulateFile(java.io.File f, CtsUrn urn, java.io.File outputDir)
Creates a Tabulator object and uses it to tabulate a given document.
Parameters:
f - The source file in the archive to tabulate.
urn - The URN for the file to tabulate.
outputDir - A writeable directory for output files.

tabulateRepository

void tabulateRepository(java.io.File outputDir)
Creates a tabular representation of every document in the corpus.
Parameters:
ouputDir - A writeable directory where tabulated files will be written.

tokenSystemForUrn

java.lang.String tokenSystemForUrn(CtsUrn urn)
Selects a tokenization system based on the language of a document identified by URN.
returns:
A String with the full name of a class implementing the tokenization interface.
throws:
Exception if cannot determine work level of urn.
Parameters:
urn - URN to map to a tokenization system.

tokenizeRepository

void tokenizeRepository(java.io.File outputDir)

tokenizeRepository

void tokenizeRepository(TokenizationSystem tokenSystem, java.io.File outputDir)
First tabulates the entire repository, then uses the resulting tabulated files to tokenize the inventory using the specified Tokenization system, and writes resulting RDF TTL in outputDir.
Parameters:
tokenSystem - TokenizationSystem to apply to the inventory.
outputDir - A writable directory where the output will be created.

tokenizeRepository

void tokenizeRepository(TokenizationSystem tokenSystem, java.io.File outputDir, java.lang.String dividerString)
First tabulates the entire inventory, then uses the resulting tabulated files to tokenize the inventory using the specified Tokenization system, and writes resulting RDF TTL in outputDir. Tabulated files are deleted after tokenization.
Parameters:
tokenSystem - TokenizationSystem to apply to the inventory.
outputDir - A writable directory where the output will be created.
dividerString - String value used to separator fields of tabulated files.

tokenizeTabFiles

void tokenizeTabFiles(java.io.File outputDir)

ttl

void ttl(java.io.File outputFile, java.io.File tabDir)
Writes a RDF TTL representation of the entire CTS repository to a file. First generates TTL for the repository's TextInventory, then tabulates all files in the repository, and turtleizes the resulting tab files.
Parameters:
ttlFile - Writable output file.
tabDir - Writable directory for generated tab files.

ttl

void ttl(java.io.File ttlFile, boolean includePrefix, java.io.File tabDir)
Writes a RDF TTL representation of the entire CTS repository to a file. First generates TTL for the repository's TextInventory, then tabulates all files in the repository, and turtleizes the resulting tab files. All output is written to outputFile.
Parameters:
ttlFile - Writable output file.
includePrefix - Whether or not to including prefix statements in the output RDF.
tabDir - Writable directory for generated tab files.

turtleizeRepository

void turtleizeRepository(java.io.File outputDir)
Creates TTL representation of the entire corpus and writes it to a file in outputDir.
throws:
Exception if unable to write to outputDir.
Parameters:
outputDir - A writable directory where the TTL file will be written.

turtleizeTabs

void turtleizeTabs(java.io.File outputDir)
Cycles through all tabular files in a directory, turtleizing each file. Output is written to a file named "cts.ttl" in the same directory.
Parameters:
outputDir - Directory containing tabular format files with names ending in 'txt'. Must be a writable directory.

turtleizeTabs

void turtleizeTabs(java.io.File outputDir, boolean destructive)
Cycles through all tabular files in a directory, first turtleizing each file. If destructive is true, it then deletes the source file. Output is written to a file named "cts.ttl" in the same directory.
Parameters:
outputDir - Directory containing tabular format files with names ending in 'txt'. Must be a writable directory.
destructive - True if tab files should be deleted after turtelizing.

turtleizeTabs

void turtleizeTabs(java.io.File outputDir, java.lang.String ttlFileName, boolean destructive)
Cycles through all tabular files in a directory, first turtleizing each file. If destructive is true, it then deletes the source file. Output is written ttlFileName.
Parameters:
outputDir - Directory containing tabular format files with names ending in 'txt'. Must be a readable directory.
ttlFileName - Name of output file.
destructive - True if tab files should be deleted after turtelizing.

turtleizeTabsFast

void turtleizeTabsFast(java.io.File outputDir, java.io.File ttl, boolean destructive)

turtleizeTabsToFile

void turtleizeTabsToFile(java.io.File outputDir, java.io.File ttl, boolean destructive)
Cycles through all tabular files in a directory, first turtleizing each file. If destructive is true, it then deletes the source file. Output is written to a file named "cts.ttl" in the same directory.
Parameters:
outputDir - Directory containing tabular format files with names ending in 'txt'. Must be a writable directory.
ttl - Output file.
destructive - True if tab files should be deleted after turtelizing.

urnsInInventory

java.util.ArrayList urnsInInventory()
Creates a list of CTS URNs for documents marked in the corpus text inventory as online.

validateInventory

void validateInventory()
Validates the XML serialization of the corpus's TextInventory against the published schema for a CITE TextInventory.
throws:
Exception if the XML does not validate.

validateInventory

void validateInventory(java.io.File schemaFie)
